member.summary: Controls how empty pages are treated during the conversion.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentConverterEmptyPageMode.None
member.summary: (0) Empty page will be added to the document and no checking is performed.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentConverterEmptyPageMode.Skip
member.summary: (1) Skip empty pages. The page is considered not empty if the annotations container for page contains items.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentConverterEmptyPageMode.SkipIgnoreAnnotations
member.summary: (2) Skip empty pages. The page is considered empty even if the annotations container for page contains items.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentConverterJobErrorMode
member.summary: Controls how the engine handles errors that may occur during conversion.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentConverterJobErrorMode.Abort
member.summary: (0) Abort the conversion job.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentConverterJobErrorMode.Resume
member.summary: (1) Continue on non critical errors.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentConverterSvgImagesRecognitionMode
member.summary: Determines how image elements inside SVG documents are treated during SVG conversion.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentConverterSvgImagesRecognitionMode.Disabled
member.summary: (1) Do not use OCR recognition for the image elements. Instead, the image element is added as is to the final document.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentConverterSvgImagesRecognitionMode.Always
member.summary: (2) Use OCR recognition on the image elements. The recognition data is added to the final document with the rest of the other SVG elements of the page.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentDataType
member.summary: Data type of a LEADDocument.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentDataType.0
member.summary: The document is created but has not been saved to the cache yet.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentDataType.1
member.summary: The document data is saved in the cache.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentDataType.2
member.summary: The document is virtual.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentFontStyles
member.summary: Font style.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions
member.summary: Options to use when getting an SVG document for a page.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions.None
member.summary: (0) Default. Get the SVG as is.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions.AllowPolylineText
member.summary: (1) This enumeration is deprecated and replaced by ForceTextPath.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions.DropImages
member.summary: (2) Drop the image elements of the SVG during load.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions.DropShapes
member.summary: (4) Drop any element that is not text or image during load.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions.DropText
member.summary: (8) Drop the text elements of the SVG during load.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions.ForConversion
member.summary: (16) The created SVG should be optimized for conversion.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions.IgnoreXmlParsingErrors
member.summary: (32) The engine will should relax the XML parsing rules and try to ignore insignificant errors in the XML data if possible.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions.ForceRealText
member.summary: (64) Indicates that all text is converted to text elements.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentGetSvgOptions.ForceTextPath
member.summary: (1) Indicates that all text is replaced by path elements.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentLinkType
member.summary: Type of a document link object.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentLinkType.Value
member.summary: (0) Use DocumentLink.Value. The link target is an external value.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentLinkType.TargetPage
member.summary: (1) Use DocumentLink.Target.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentLoadMode
member.summary: Load document mode.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentLoadMode.0
member.summary: Always call the service. This is default behavior.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentLoadMode.1
member.summary: Try to load the document locally in the client without calling the service.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentLoadMode.2
member.summary: Try to load the document locally; if that fails, try to load it using the service.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentPageFitType
member.summary: Specifies how to fit the page when an internal link is invoked.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentPageFitType.None
member.summary: (0) No fitting. Use Position and ZoomPercent if they have valid values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentPageFitType.Fit
member.summary: (1) Show the whole page in the view. If the page is smaller, do not zoom in.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentPageFitType.FitAlways
member.summary: (2) Show the whole page in the view. If the page is smaller, zoom in to fit.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentPageFitType.FitWidth
member.summary: (1) Fit page width.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentPageFitType.FitHeight
member.summary: (2) Fit page height.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentRedactionMode
member.summary: Annotations redaction mode.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentRedactionMode.0
member.summary: Do not apply any annotations. Default behavior. All annotations are visible and live when viewing or converting.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentRedactionMode.1
member.summary: Apply the annotations and keep SVG pages.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentRedactionMode.2
member.summary: Apply the annotations then rasterize SVG pages.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentTextExtractionMode
member.summary: Mode to use when extracting text from this document.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentTextExtractionMode.Auto
member.summary: (0) Automatic. This depends on the document type, if it supports SVG, then SVG is used, otherwise, use OCR (if available).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentTextExtractionMode.SvgOnly
member.summary: (1) Use SVG only if the document supports it. Otherwise, do not extract text.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentTextExtractionMode.OcrOnly
member.summary: (2) Use OCR always even if the document supports SVG.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Document.DocumentTextImagesRecognitionMode
member.summary: Indicates how to treat the image elements encountered in the input SVG page during text extraction.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentTextImagesRecognitionMode.0
member.summary: Use SVG engine unless the page is fully rastered.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentTextImagesRecognitionMode.1
member.summary: Do not use OCR recognition for the image elements. Instead, the image elements are ignored.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Document.DocumentTextImagesRecognitionMode.2
member.summary: Use OCR recognition on the image elements. The recognition data is added to the final document page text with the rest of the other SVG elements of the page. Requires a valid IOcrEngine instance.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology
member.summary: The barcode symbologies supported by LEADTOOLS

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown symbology type. This has a special meaning in some of the methods that use BarcodeSymbology.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.EAN13
member.summary: (International Article Number with 13 digits) symbology. Used internationally with consumer products.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.EAN8
member.summary: Derived from the longer European Article Number (EAN-13) code. It was introduced for use on small packages where an EAN-13 barcode would be too large.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.UPCA
member.summary: (Universal Product Code). Used with consumer products in the United States.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.UPCE
member.summary: The short version of UPC-A.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Code3Of9
member.summary: (Code 39) type. Used especially in non-retail environments.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Code128
member.summary: Code 128 type. Very dense code, used extensively worldwide.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.CodeInterleaved2Of5
member.summary: Interleaved 2 of 5 type. Used in warehouse, industrial applications.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Codabar
member.summary: (Ames Code/USD-4/NW-7/2 of 7 Code) type. Used in libraries and blood banks.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.UCCEAN128
member.summary: UCCEAND 128 type

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Code93
member.summary: Code 93 type. Compressed form of Code 39

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.EANEXT5
member.summary: 5-digit supplemental type. May be used with UPCA, UPCE, EAN13 and EAN8 on books to indicate a suggested retail price.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.EANEXT2
member.summary: 2-digit supplemental type. May be used with UPCA, UPCE, EAN13 and EAN8 to indicate magazines and newspaper issue numbers.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.MSI
member.summary: MSI (Modified Plessey) type. Used to mark retail shelves for inventory control.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Code11
member.summary: Code 11 (USD-8) type. Used in labeling telecommunications equipment.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.CodeStandard2Of5
member.summary: Standard 2 of 5 (Industrial 2 of 5) type. Used in the photofinishing, warehouse sorting industries and sequentially numbering airline tickets.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.GS1Databar
member.summary: GS1 Databar (formerly RSS14) type. Used in grocery industry, healthcare, and where items are too small to allow for older barcode symbologies.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.GS1DatabarLimited
member.summary: GS1 Databar (formerly RSS14) Limited type. It is a short version of GS1 Databar (formerly RSS14).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.GS1DatabarExpanded
member.summary: GS1 Databar (formerly RSS14) Expanded type. It encodes item identification plus supplementary strings such as weight and date. Used in grocery industry and healthcare.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.PatchCode
member.summary: Patch Code type. Used only for batch separation and scanner control, primarily with Kodak scanners.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.PostNet
member.summary: (Postal Numeric Encoding Technique). Used by the United States Postal Service to assist in directing mail.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Planet
member.summary: (Postal Alpha Numeric Encoding Technique). Used by the United States Postal Service to identify and track pieces of mail during delivery.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.AustralianPost4State
member.summary: Australian Post 4-State type.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.RoyalMail4State
member.summary: Royal Mail (RM4SCC) 4-State type.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.USPS4State
member.summary: USPS OneCode 4-State Barcode (4BC) type.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.GS1DatabarStacked
member.summary: GS1 Databar (formerly RSS14) Stacked / GS1 Databar Stacked Omni-Directional types. Used as GS1 Databar when the available space is too narrow for the standard GS1 Databar.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.GS1DatabarExpandedStacked
member.summary: GS1 Databar (formerly RSS14) Expanded Stacked barcode type. Used as GS1 Databar Expanded when the available space is too narrow to fit in one line.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.PDF417
member.summary: (Portable Data File). 2D symbol used in a variety of applications, primarily transport, identification cards, and inventory management. Note, the PDF417 barcode symbology does not have any relation to Adobe PDF (Portable Document Format).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.MicroPDF417
member.summary: (Portable Data File). Version of PDF417 that can hold up to 150 bytes of data. Note, the MicroPDF417 barcode symbology does not have any relation to Adobe PDF (Portable Document Format).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Datamatrix
member.summary: Datamatrix. 2D symbol code used for marking small items.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.QR
member.summary: (short for Quick Response). 2D symbol used by dedicated QR barcode readers and camera phones.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Aztec
member.summary: Aztec. 2D symbol used for train tickets, airline tickets and government documents. This barcode is able to reduce the required space over other matrix barcode as it does not require a surrounding quiet zone.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.Maxi
member.summary: MaxiCode. 2D symbol developed and used by the United Parcel Service to idand track pieces of mail during delivery.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.MicroQR
member.summary: Micro QR. 2D symbol used where symbol size is limited. There are four sizes; the largest is capable of encoding 35 characters. Some sizes support more than one error correction level.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Barcode.BarcodeSymbology.PharmaCode
member.summary: PharmaCode type. Used in the pharmaceutical industry as a packing control system.

member.summary: Indicates the rotation angle for the original document page.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Document.Compare.CompareRasterPageOptions.outputAddition
member.summary: Color corresponding to an addition region in the output document.
member.value: A string value corresponding to an HTML color. The color corresponds to a region in the output document that was not in the original document. The default value is `rgb(0,255,0)`.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Document.Compare.CompareRasterPageOptions.outputBackground
member.summary: The background color in the output document.
member.value: A string value corresponding to an HTML color. The default value is `rgb(255,255,255)`.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Document.Compare.CompareRasterPageOptions.outputChange
member.summary: A color corresponding to a change region in the output document.
member.value: A string value corresponding to an HTML color, used in the output image to indicate pixels which were different in both images (but were neither an addition nor deletion). The default value is `rgb(255, 255, 0)`.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Document.Compare.CompareRasterPageOptions.outputDeletion
member.summary: The color corresponding to a deletion region in the output document.
member.value: A string value corresponding to an HTML color, used in the output image to indicate pixels which were background content in the modified image, but not in the original image. Additionally, any pixels within the bounds of the original image that were not within the bounds of the modified image will be marked with this color. The default value is `rgb(255, 0, 0)`.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Document.Compare.CompareRasterPageOptions.outputExternal
member.summary: Color corresponding to an external region in the output document.
member.value: A string value corresponding to an HTML color, used in the output image to indicate pixels which are not part of either image. The default value is `rgb(128, 128, 255)`.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Document.Compare.CompareRasterPageOptions.outputMatch
member.summary: Color corresponding to a match region in the output document.
member.value: A string value corresponding to an HTML color, used in the output image to indicate pixels that are equal in both the original and modified images. The default value is `rgb(64, 64, 64)`.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Document.Compare.CompareRasterPageOptions.threshold
member.summary: A number indicating the color threshold.
member.value: A valid number. The default value is 30.
